# fmt
<!-- START_SECTION:BADGES_SECTION -->
<a href="docs/img/badges.svg"><img src="docs/img/badges.svg" alt="Project Badges" title="Generated by devflow from github.com/tinywasm/devflow"></a>
<!-- END_SECTION:BADGES_SECTION -->

fmt is a lightweight Go library that provides comprehensive string manipulation, type conversion, formatting, and multilingual error handling with a fluid API, specifically designed for small devices and web applications using TinyGo as the target compiler.

## Key Features

- ğŸš€ **Fluid and chainable API** - Easy to use and readable operations
- ğŸ“ **Complete string toolkit** - Transformations, conversions, formatting, and error handling
- ğŸŒ **Multilingual error messages** - Built-in dictionary system with 9 languages
- ğŸ§µ **Concurrency safe** - Thread-safe operations for concurrent environments
- ğŸ“¦ **Zero dependencies** - No `fmt`, `strings`, `strconv`, or `errors` imports
- ğŸ¯ **TinyGo optimized** - Manual implementations for minimal binary size
- ğŸŒ **WebAssembly-first** - Designed for modern web deployment
- ğŸ”„ **Universal type support** - Works with strings, numbers, booleans, and slices
- âš¡ **Performance focused** - Predictable allocations and custom optimizations

## [Why fmt?](docs/WHY.md)

## Installation

```bash
go get github.com/tinywasm/fmt
```

## Usage

```go
import . "github.com/tinywasm/fmt"

// Quick start - Basic conversion and transformation
text := Convert("HÃ³la MÃºndo").Tilde().ToLower().String() // out: "hola mundo"

// Working with different data types
numText := Convert(42).String()     // out: "42"
boolText := Convert(true).String()  // out: "true"

// Memory-efficient approach using string pointers
original := "Ã‰l MÃºrcielago RÃ¡pido"
Convert(&original).Tilde().CamelLow().Apply()
// original is now: "elMurcielagoRapido"

// Efficient builder and chaining with accent normalization
items := []string{"  ÃPPLE  ", "  banÃ¡na  ", "  piÃ±ata  ","  Ã‘ANDÃš  "}
builder := Convert() // without params reused buffer = optimal performance
for i, item := range items {
    processed := Convert(item).
        TrimSpace(). // TrimSpace whitespace
        Tilde(). // Normalize accents
        ToLower(). // Convert to lowercase
        Capitalize(). // Capitalize first letter
        String() // Finalize the string
    builder.Write(processed)
    if i < len(items)-1 {
        builder.Write(" - ")
    }
}

out := builder.String() // Finalize the string hiding the error
out, err := builder.StringErr() // OR finalize with error handling

// out: "Apple - Banana - PiÃ±ata - Ã‘andu", err: nil

// Check for uppercase prefix (supports Unicode)
isUpper := HasUpperPrefix("Ãpple") // out: true
```
